intro: Sloanea onotillo var. major, commonly known as the giant sloanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. This evergreen shrub or small tree can grow up to 10 meters in height, characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by woody, spherical fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the high-altitude conditions of its native habitat.
